secret_rule: The item can be brought to the picnic only if its name is a single-word noun that starts with the letter 'U'.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "umbrella" and "uniform".
I would like to ask the game master if "universe" can be brought to the game.
I would like to ask the game master if "utensil" can be brought to the game.
I would like to ask the game master if "unicorn" can be brought to the game.
Player: I would like to ask the game master if "underground" can be brought to the game.

The rule seems to be that the items you can bring must start with the letter "u" and be a noun composed of two syllables. The examples and confirmations ("umbrella," "uniform," "universe," "utensil," "unicorn") all satisfy this condition, while "underground" does not, as it has three syllables.
